This could be anything from an exhibition to an academic publication. ","children":[{"title":"Assessment","text":"","children":[{"title":"Formative","text":"This is a three part assessment that has real world relevance and the assessment is integrated seamlessly into the task. It also requires students to collaborate and consider multiple stakeholders and perspectives. - Group minutes, budget, action plan and funding bids - Individual student work logs and the preparation of a CV - Project display ","children":[]},{"title":"Summative","text":"Students are required to write a 3000 word reflective essay which not only asks students to reflect on the success of their own projects, but also the role for classics in the wider community.","children":[]}]},{"title":"Learning","text":"Aside from the summative essay, students are required to work in groups to produce a polished end product. Sessions include training sessions from Careers, RED and more, demonstrating a variety of perspectives and developing a range of skills.","children":[]}]}]}]},{"title":"English","text":"","children":[{"title":"Creative Non-Fiction","text":"","children":[]},{"title":"History of Art","text":"","children":[]},{"title":"Religion not only requires students to think about academic theorists conceptualize gender and sex, but also how that is relevant to politics, citizenship and democracy.","children":[]},{"title":"Assessment","text":" - 25% - 'Feature Article' on a famous feminist. This can be a real or imagined publication and requires students to think about how the famous feminist would talk but also develop their own interview style, and how that would fit the tone of their publication. - 75% - A briefing proposing a research programme to a 'think tank' that includes an action plan and budget. This demonstrates students using their skills to consider multiple stakeholders and how that could be relevant to the real world. ","children":[]},{"title":"Learning","text":"This module requires students to think about how feminist thought is relevant to the 'real-world' in issues such as maternity leave and pay and discrimination. They should acquire skills outside of the classroom such as budgeting and engaging non-academic writing.","children":[]}]},{"title":"Gaston's Unit","text":"","children":[]}]},{"title":"School of Education","text":"51.455119, -2.604897","children":[]},{"title":"School for Economics Finance and Management","text":"51.459994, -2.604883","children":[]},{"title":"University of Bristol Law School","text":"-2.604476,51.456456","children":[{"title":"Law In Action","text":"[Law in Action](https://www.bris.ac.uk/unit-programme-catalogue/UnitDetails.jsa?ayrCode=20%2F21&unitLevelCode=ALL&tbCode=TB-4&unitCode=LAWD10018) ","children":[]}]},{"title":"Richmond Building","text":"-2.6150709,51.4568702","children":[{"title":"Bristol Hub","text":"","children":[{"title":"Social Impact Voluntary Scheme","text":"","children":[]},{"title":"Social Innovation Project","text":"","children":[]}]},{"title":"Bristol SU","text":"","children":[{"title":"Society Committee Members","text":" - President and Vice - Treasurer - Social Secretary - Wellbeing Officer ","children":[{"title":"Training Offered","text":"Student-Led Volunteering Opportunities Student Led Projects @ Bristol SU ","children":[]}]}]}]}]
